IniReaderCore Class

Extends EventEmitter
Defined in: lib/inireader.js:139
Module: IniReader

Parses a .ini file and convert's it's content to a JS object Parser regexps are from the Config::Simple Perl module

Constructor

IniReaderCore

(
  • [cfg]
  • [async]
)

Defined in lib/inireader.js:139

Parameters:

  • [cfg] Object optional

    Configuration object. (In older versions it could be a string too, which was the file name to parse, but that behaviour is deprectaed)

    • [async] Boolean optional

      If true, it will use asynchronous calls to read and write files

    • [file] String optional

      The file name to read or write during operations

  • [async] Boolean optional

    (Deprecated) Use the cfg.async instead.

fixQuoted

(
  • str
)
String private

Defined in lib/inireader.js:95

If a string is inside quotes, the quotes will be removed It doesn't care about escaped/not escaped strings. So you can have thing like this: "lorem ipsum" dolor sit" and you will receive: lorem ipsum" dolor sit

Parameters:

  • str String

Returns:

String: String without starting and closing quotes

() String | Number | Object | Null | Boolean | Undefiend deprecated

Defined in lib/inireader.js:320

Method to get a one property value or a ini block or all of the block of the loaded configuration

Returns:

String | Number | Object | Null | Boolean | Undefiend: The property value

(
  • [le]
)
String

Defined in lib/inireader.js:430

Parameters:

  • [le] String optional

    Predefined line ending character. Only "\n", "\r" and "\r\n" are valid values!

Returns:

String: The line ending character or characters. Default is "\n"

(

  • cb
  • async
)
Array private

Defined in lib/inireader.js:55

Reads a file and returns it's lines as an array

Parameters:

  • file String

    File name to load and parse

  • cb Function

    Callback function to call when parse finished

  • async Boolean

    Use synchronous or asynchronous file operations

Returns:

Array: Lines of the file

getParam

(
  • [param]
)
String | Number | Object | Null | Boolean | Undefiend

Defined in lib/inireader.js:347

Method to get the configuration tree or a configuration block a specific value in a block.

Parameters:

  • [param] String optional

    The name of the block where the key should be defined. You can get the whole configuration tree by not setting this argument. You can get a configuration block by passing its name: getParam('fooblock'). You can get a specific property by passing its block name with the property name. They should be concatenated with a ".": getParam('fooblock.barproperty').

Returns:

String | Number | Object | Null | Boolean | Undefiend: The property value

(
  • String

String | Number | Object | Null | Boolean | Undefiend deprecated

    block The name of the block where the key should be defined

  • String Object

    key The name of the key which value should be returned

Returns:

String | Number | Object | Null | Boolean | Undefiend: the value of the key

param

(
  • prop
  • value
)
String | Number | Object | Null | Boolean | Undefiend

Defined in lib/inireader.js:408

Setter and getter method. If only the first parameter defined it will return the value of the parameter. If the second parameter set, it will set the parameter in the loaded configuration object.

Parameters:

  • prop String

    The name of the property which should be returned or which should be set

  • value String | Number | Object | Null | Boolean

    The new value of the property

Returns:

String | Number | Object | Null | Boolean | Undefiend: The property value if the method was called with one argument or undefined if it was called with two arguments

Properties

async

Boolean

Defined in lib/inireader.js:170

If true all file operation will be done asynchronously

Default: false

chompRex

Unknown private final

Defined in lib/inireader.js:11

Regular expression to remove white space chars from the beginning and end of a line

file

String

Defined in lib/inireader.js:160

Name of the file. Doing a load method and without specifying it's name directly that property will be used. Doing a write method and without specifying it's name directly that property will be used.

Default: null

Unknown private final

Defined in lib/inireader.js:33
